perturbation.original_text:
14 RESTRICTIVE COVENANTS

14.7 During the Restricted Period you shall provide a copy of the restrictions contained at paragraph 13 above and this paragraph 14 to any employer or prospective employer or any other party with whom you become or will become engaged or provide service or services to.
perturbation.changed_text:
5 BENEFITS

5.5 Further to section 14.7, During the Restricted Period you shall provide a copy of the restrictions contained at paragraph 13 above and this paragraph 14 to any employer or prospective employer or any other party with whom you become or will become engaged or provide service or services to.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the requirement to disclose restrictive covenants to potential employers from the 'Restrictive Covenants' section to the 'Benefits' section. This placement is misleading as it obscures the legal duty within a section that employees would typically view as advantageous, decreasing the likelihood of compliance and increasing ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction, but generally affects the enforceability of non-compete agreements due to lack of clear and conspicuous notice.

perturbation.original_text:
22 JURISDICTION AND CHOICE OF LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of England and Wales and the parties to this Agreement submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts of England and Wales in relation to any claim, dispute or matter arising out of or relating to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
9 SICKNESS AND OTHER ABSENCE

9.7 This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of England and Wales and the parties to this Agreement submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Courts of England and Wales in relation to any claim, dispute or matter arising out of or relating to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the 'Jurisdiction and Choice of Law' clause to the 'Sickness and Other Absence' section. This is designed to cause confusion because the clause is critical for determining how any disputes are legally addressed. By burying it within a section related to illness and leave, the company is creating structural ambiguity as to whether they agree to the jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Legal systems generally require jurisdiction and choice of law clauses to be prominently displayed, not hidden in unrelated sections, to ensure informed consent and fairness.

perturbation.original_text:
18 DATA PROTECTION

Processing of personal data and our policies

18.1 Information relating to an individual (or from which an individual may be identified) is called "personal data".

18.2 In processing personal data, we are required to comply with the law on data protection. To help us achieve this, we have produced a privacy notice ("Privacy Notice"). This may be found in the Employee Handbook. You must read this and comply with it in carrying out your work.
perturbation.changed_text:
7 HOURS OF WORK

7.3 The Company operates under data protection policies to ensure the safety of our employee's information. Please be aware that we use and require personal data of each employee to effectively function. This may be found in the Employee Handbook. You must read this and comply with it in carrying out your work.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the 'Data Protection' clause to the 'Hours of Work' section. This is misleading because it does not emphasize the protection of the company but rather the data collection of the employee. It doesn't allow the employee to have an idea of the potential risks with data being stolen.
perturbation.contradicted_law: GDPR requires data processing to be described for employees and is violated.
